arm_group.description: The patient receives post-OP IV fentanyl PCA

arm_group.arm_group_label: post-OP IV fentanyl PCA and local infiltration
arm_group.description: pretreatment of local infiltration 0.25% bupivacaine 5 ml and post-OP IV fentanyl PCA

arm_group.arm_group_label: nerves block and post-OP IV fentanyl PCA
arm_group.description: pretreatment of peroneal nerves 0.25% bupivacaine 10 ml and post-OP IV fentanyl PCA

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to investigate the efficacy and cost analysis of intravenous
      fentanyl combined with either local anesthesia infiltration or peroneal nerves block in
      patients with Hallux Valgus undergoing orthopedic corrective surgery and compared with
      patients without local anesthetics administration perioperatively.

clinical_study.brief_title: Post-operative Pain Management In Patients Undergoing Hullax Valgus Surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. patients with American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status I-III

          2. aged 20-65 years

          3. Requiring local anesthesia and PCA use

          4. No severe cardiac or pulmonary diseases

          5. BMI <35 kg/m2

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. BMI ≧35 kg/m2

          2. age > 65years

          3. allergy to opioid or local anesthetics

intervention.arm_group_label: post-OP IV fentanyl PCA and local infiltration
intervention.intervention_name: local bupivacaine infiltration and post-OP IV fentanyl PCA

intervention.arm_group_label: nerves block and post-OP IV fentanyl PCA
intervention.intervention_name: Nerve Blocks and post-OP IV fentanyl PCA

facility.name: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Efficacy and Cost Analysis of Regional Anesthesia and Intravenous Fentanyl for Postoperative Pain Management in Patients Undergoing Hullax Valgus Surgery

other_outcome.measure: assessment of cost analysis among groups
other_outcome.time_frame: surgery period and 36 hours after surgery

overall_official.affiliation: Department of orthopaedic surgery, Kaohsiung Medical University, Taiwan

primary_outcome.description: Patients are subgrouping into groups of post-OP IV fentanyl PCA only, pretreatment of local bupivacaine infiltration and post-OP IV fentanyl PCA, and pretreatment of peroneal nerves block and post-OP IV fentanyl PCA. Resting pain and moving pain scores are measured by the numeric rating scale and classified into none, mild, moderate and severe pain four grades. Pains scale and side effects are recorded at time intervals of post-OP 0 hours, 6 hours, 12 hours, 24 hours, and 36 hours after surgery.
primary_outcome.measure: provides adequate pain relief and decreases fentanyl consumption
primary_outcome.time_frame: including of surgery and 36 hours after surgery

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: side effects include of intraoperative hypo-tension,dizziness, nausea, and vomiting.
secondary_outcome.measure: incidence of side effects and complications

clinical_study.source: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

lead_sponsor.agency: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital
